zap.title: Connect Zap to Your
zap.description: Follow this 6-step guide to connect your Zap gateway to an electricity meter with a P1 (RJ12) port. Setup typically takes 10-15 minutes.

step1.title: Enable P1 Port on Your Meter
step1.description: Contact your grid operator (e.g., Ellevio, Vattenfall, E.ON) to enable the P1 (RJ12) data port. This can often be done via their website or by calling their support team for remote activation.

tips.tip1: Most grid operators can enable P1 remotely within 24-48 hours
tips.tip2: The service is usually free of charge
tips.tip3: You may need your meter ID (found on the meter itself)

warning.title: Safety Warning
warning.message: Do not tamper with your electricity meter. Only connect devices to the designated P1 port. Read the Safety Information before setup.

step2.title: Connect Zap to Energy Meter
step2.description: Once your grid operator confirms P1 data is enabled, connect the Zap device to your electricity meter using the included RJ12 cable. The P1 port is typically located on the front or bottom of your meter.

tips.tip1: The Zap powers itself from the P1 port—no separate power needed
tips.tip2: Make sure the cable clicks securely into place
tips.tip3: Position the Zap within range of your Wi-Fi router

step3.title: Check LED Indicators
step3.description: After connection, verify these lights activate on your Zap device:

tips.tip1: If no lights appear, check the cable connection
tips.tip2: The blue LED indicates the device is ready for setup

step4.title: Verify Data Transfer
step4.description: The green data LED should start blinking when receiving meter data. This indicates your meter is sending consumption data to the Zap.

tips.tip1: This step might take a few minutes
tips.tip2: The LED blinks each time data is received (typically every 10 seconds)
tips.tip3: If it doesn't blink, your P1 port may not be enabled yet

step5.title: Download and Configure App
step5.description: Download the Sourceful Energy app from the App Store or Google Play. Create your account and register your Zap following the on-screen instructions.

tips.tip1: Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your phone
tips.tip2: Keep your phone close to the Zap during setup
tips.tip3: You'll need to connect the Zap to your Wi-Fi network

step6.title: Completion Verification
step6.description: When fully operational, your Zap and app should show the following:

tips.tip1: The app should display real-time energy consumption
tips.tip3: The Zap now communicates via Wi-Fi

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: If you encounter any issues during setup, check our Help Centre for troubleshooting guides or join our community for support.

next.title: What's Next?
next.description: Once connected, explore the Sourceful app to monitor your energy usage, set up alerts, and start optimizing your consumption.

inverter.title: Connect Zap to Your
inverter.description: Follow this 6-step guide to connect your Zap gateway to a solar inverter via Modbus TCP/IP. Setup typically takes 15-20 minutes.

step1.title: Locate Inverter Network Settings
step1.description: Gather your inverter's network settings: IP address, Unit ID, and Port Number. These can typically be found on the inverter's display or through your installer.

tips.tip2: Unit ID: Often 1 or 247 (check your inverter's documentation)

info.title: Modbus TCP Required
info.message: If Modbus TCP is not enabled on your inverter, ask your installer to enable it or check our configuration guides. Some inverters require direct RS485 wired connections instead.

step2.title: Power the Zap Device
step2.description: The Zap needs power to operate. You have two options:

optionA.title: Option A: P1 Meter Port
optionA.description: Connect to your electricity meter's P1 (RJ12) port for power and meter data

optionB.title: Option B: USB-C Power
optionB.description: Use any USB-C power source: phone charger, computer, or inverter's USB port

tips.tip1: The Zap must remain within range of your Wi-Fi router
tips.tip2: If using USB-C, ensure the power source is always on
tips.tip3: P1 connection provides both power AND meter data

step3.title: Check LED Indicators
step3.description: After powering on, verify these lights activate on your Zap device:

tips.tip1: If no lights appear, check the power connection
tips.tip2: The blue LED indicates the device is ready for setup
tips.tip3: Troubleshooting guide available in our Help Centre

step4.title: Download the Sourceful App
step4.description: Install the Sourceful Energy app from the App Store or Google Play Store. Create an account and register your Zap device following on-screen prompts.

tips.tip1: Bluetooth must be enabled on your phone
tips.tip2: Keep your phone close to the Zap during setup
tips.tip3: You'll connect the Zap to your Wi-Fi network through the app

step5.title: Connect Your Inverter
step5.description: In the app, select 'Add an Energy Device' and enter the network settings from Step 1. The app will connect to your inverter via Modbus TCP.

tips.tip1: Make sure the Zap and inverter are on the same network
tips.tip2: Enter the IP address, port, and unit ID exactly as found in Step 1
tips.tip3: The system supports up to three DERs (at least one must be an energy meter)

info.title: Multiple Devices
info.message: You can connect multiple energy devices (solar, battery, meter) to a single Zap. Add them one at a time through the app.

step6.title: Verify Successful Connection
step6.description: When fully operational, your Zap and app should show the following:

tips.tip1: The app should display real-time solar production data
tips.tip3: The Zap now communicates via Wi-Fi

help.description: If you encounter any issues during setup, check our Help Centre for inverter-specific configuration guides or join our community for support.
